description: The terminals that came out of the box didn't support emojis, copy and paste didn't work. I was accustomed to emojis on my command prompt. I suppose wayland changed the game a bit. This terminal seems to be addressing the changes. Has bugs, for example backspace doesn't work when you ssh to another machine. Version 1.6.4 is acceptable for daily use.
summary: I would like that color emoji support

description: One of the few emulators that supports the escape sequence to add things to your paste buffer. The newer version (11) is a lot nicer than the one in Debian Stable, but even this one is pretty great for my needs.

- Fast rendering
- Supports Wayland natively
- Not a wrapper on top of old and buggy libvte
- Supports padding: no huge border on bottom and right sides.
